questions: Which historical figure's life do you find most inspiring, and what about their story speaks to you?
If you could keep only one book that has shaped your worldview, which would it be and why?
Which values do you think are absolutely non-negotiable when making major decisions?
If you were giving a close friend advice on how to make a major decision, what would you tell them?
What kind of music or poetry do you think most reflects something larger than yourself?
Which season of the year carries the deepest symbolism for you, and why?
What moral lesson do you wish more people took seriously?
What kind of moral principle do you think is far too often ignored?
Which story or myth do you think best captures the human experience?
When you seek guidance, where do you usually look first?
What is a tradition -- ancient or modern -- that you hope never disappears?
If you had to choose a single word that centers you, what would it be, and what does it represent?
What kind of architecture or physical space makes you feel most at peace?
What is your favorite work of fiction that you think still says something important and true?
Do you think there is a God, and if so, what is your evidence for it?
Is there a specific historical figure from the 1800s you admire?
Is there a historical figure from the 1200s that you admire?
What author from the 1800s do you think is really underrated?
What author from the early 1900s do you think should be read more?
Why does human suffering exist?
If you could place one proverb above every doorway in your city, what would it say, and why that message?
What's one of the most beautiful songs you know?
What's one of the greatest movies that you know?
What's one of the most beautiful paintings that you know?
What's one of the most beautiful sculptures that you know?
What's one of the most beautiful buildings that you know?
If you could have a conversation with one historical figure, who would it be and what would you ask them?
Which philosopher's ideas do you think are most enduring?
If you could be born at some time in the past, in any location, when would you choose to be born?
What's one of the most beautiful poems you know?
If you could visit any city in France, which would it be and why?
Suppose you could visit any location in Spain, which would it be and why?
Imagine you could visit any place in England, where would you go and why?
What places in the Middle East would you like to visit?
If you could see any famous historical event, which would it be and why?
Suppose you had a time machine. It lets you see any event in history, from 1900 to 1500 A.D. You can't change it, only watch it. What would you see?
What do you think is a particularly beautiful building in the world?
What do you think is the greatest work of philosophy ever made?
What writer do you think is horribly, horribly underrated?
What's a lesser-known author you think is a genius?
What's a lesser-known philosopher you think is a genius?
Are there any paintings from the Renaissance that you think are underrated?
Do you have a favorite sculpture?
Suppose you were trapped on a desert island. You can have 3 books only. Which 3 would you choose?
